revision.text: ==Martuthunira== ===Etymology=== From Proto-Ngayarda ''*yalhuru'', from Proto-Pama-Nyungan ''*yalʸu'' "flame". ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|vma|/jal̪uɻu/}} ===Noun=== {{head|vma|nouns}} # [[tongue|Tongue]]. ===See also=== * {{l|vma|kartawura}} ===References=== * {{R:aus-pam:Alpher}} * Dench, Alan Charles. 1995. ''Martuthunira: A Language of the Pilbara Region of Western Australia.'' Canberra: Pacific Linguistics. Series C-125. [[Category:vma:Anatomy]] ---- ==Panyjima== ===Etymology=== From Proto-Ngayarda ''*yalhuru'', from Proto-Pama-Nyungan ''*yalʸu'' "flame". ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|pnw|/jal̪uɻu/}} ===Noun=== {{head|pnw|nouns}} # [[tongue|Tongue]]. ===References=== * {{R:aus-pam:Alpher}} * Dench, Alan. 1991. ‘Panyjima’. R.M.W. Dixon, Barry J. Blake (eds.) ''The Handbook of Australian Languages, Volume 4''. Melbourne: Oxford University Press Australia, 125–244. [[Category:pnw:Anatomy]]
